or raising wages, but it's
really bothering them.

1486.75.text:
They have a
plan to sue me.

1489.49.text:
They have plans to sue
me for taking executive

1493.46.text:
actions that are within my
authority --

1506.14.text:
Rather than engage in
political stunts

1509.57.text:
that waste time and taxpayer
money, join me.

1521.69.text:
Let's help families
with childcare costs.

1524.99.text:
There are all kinds
of things we can do.

1526.99.text:
Don't be mad at me
for doing something.

1529.53.text:
How about teaming
up with me.

1545.74.text:
Gosh, doesn't it get
you just frustrated?

1552.25.text:
We could do so
much more if Republicans

1555.55.text:
in Congress focused less
on protecting

1558.19.text: the folks who've got the lobbyists

1560.19.text: and all that soft money out there.

1564.60.text:
Stop worrying about the
folks who already got --

1574.21.text:
That's what makes this
country great --

1576.21.text:
a sense of common purpose and
patriotism,

1578.48.text:
an economic patriotism that says
we fall

1581.71.text: and we rise as one nation, as one people.

1586.08.text:
So we can rally America
around an economic

1590.42.text:
tax breaks to millionaires and
billionaires,

1592.96.text:
let's give more tax breaks to
help working families

1597.30.text:
Let's rally
around a patriotism that

1599.56.text:
says, don't give tax
loopholes to corporations

1602.93.text:
shifting jobs overseas,
let's put people back

1605.24.text:
to work here rebuilding our
roads, our bridges,

1607.24.text:
our airports, making sure
the next generation

1609.24.text:
of manufacturing is
made in America.

1616.21.text:
Don't stack the deck in
favor

1619.38.text:
We're stronger when we're
helping everybody succeed,

1621.72.text:
cultivating every talent
of every child --

1624.86.text:
every 4-year-old in America,
give them high-quality

1627.66.text:
preschool so they're safe
and taught well while

1630.43.text:
we go to work and redesign
our high schools

1632.83.text:
to better prepare our kids for
the 21st century.

1635.63.text:
And tell every American,
you know, if your

1638.90.text:
job was stamped "obsolete," if
it was shipped overseas,

1641.54.text:
we're going to train you
for an even better one.

1645.91.text:
We need an economic
patriotism that says

1647.91.text:
it's a good thing that
everybody

1654.19.text:
It's a good thing when
women are paid the same

1660.13.text:
as men for doing
the same work.

1665.10.text:
It's a good thing when
parents

1667.43.text:
have some flexibility when
their kids are sick.

1669.50.text:
It will make the employees
more loyal;

1673.87.text:
It's a good thing when
nobody who works full-time

1687.22.text:
I know that sometimes
it must be frustrating

1698.33.text:
There are some things that
I have to mutter under

1704.77.text:
And the hardest
thing to change

1705.90.text:
in politics is a
stubborn status quo.

1707.91.text:
And it's harder when
Washington seems

1713.38.text:
distracted by everything
except the things

1716.95.text:
And there's a cottage
industry in Washington

1718.95.text:
that counts on you just
being cynical about stuff,

1721.42.text:
so that you don't vote,
you don't get involved,

1723.42.text:
you get discouraged, you
say a plague

1727.73.text:
But you can't give
into that cynicism.

1729.73.text:
Do not let them win by you
being cynical, because

1737.00.text:
despite all the obstruction,
America is making progress.

1743.17.text:
We're going to be better
off five years from

1745.14.text: now than we are right now.

1746.14.text:
Despite the unyielding
opposition of a few,

1750.32.text:
there are workers who have jobs
who didn't

1753.32.text:
There are families who
have health insurance

1756.32.text:
There are students who can
afford

1758.32.text:
to go to college who couldn't
afford to go before.

1760.33.text:
There are troops who are
home with their

1762.29.text:
families after serving tour
after tour of war.

1772.37.text:
Cynicism is a popular
choice these days.

1774.87.text:
It's what passes
off for wisdom.

1782.31.text:
And remember that
it is a choice.

1784.32.text:
Cynicism is a choice, and
hope is a better choice.

1787.15.text:
And it's a choice that I
make every time I sit down

1795.63.text: I had dinner with last night.

1800.30.text:
It's the hope that Alex
has when she sits down

1802.40.text:
and she picks up a pen and she
writes to the President

1807.24.text:
hoping that the system
still works; hoping

1809.24.text:
maybe the letter gets there;
hoping that I'll listen;

1815.01.text:
hoping that even when
Washington seems

1816.81.text:
tone deaf, your voice might
reach a President,

1821.49.text:
your voice might reach a crowd
in a park, your voice

1825.49.text:
might move fellow citizens
to change

1830.13.text:
Every day I receive these
thousands

1833.93.text: of acts of hope from you.

1839.14.text: It's why I ran for office.

1841.21.text:
It's why I'm
fighting for you.

1844.04.text:
I will keep treating your
cares and concerns

1847.78.text:
I will keep trying to
restore the American Dream

1849.78.text:
for everybody who is
willing to work for it.
